phrasal_verbs.meaning: to behave badly; to malfunction
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: My computer is acting up again.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to support someone; to move backwards
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Please back up your computer files regularly.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to explode; to become very angry
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: The balloon blew up when it hit the sharp edge.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to stop working or functioning; to collapse emotionally
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: My car broke down on the highway yesterday.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to enter illegally; to interrupt
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Someone broke in while we were on vacation.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to escape; to suddenly start (war, disease)
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Three prisoners broke out of jail last night.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to end a relationship; to separate into pieces
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: They broke up after dating for two years.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to return something; to restore
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: This song brings back memories of my childhood.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to mention or introduce a topic; to raise a child
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: She brought up an interesting point during the meeting.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to cancel something
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: They had to call off the picnic due to rain.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to become less angry or excited
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Please calm down and tell me what happened.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to continue doing something
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Please carry on with your presentation.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to reach the same level as someone else
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: I need to catch up on my reading.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to examine; to leave a hotel
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: We need to check out of the hotel by noon.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to make something tidy
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Let's clean up the kitchen after dinner.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to find or encounter something unexpectedly
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: I came across an old photo while cleaning my room.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to return to a place
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: What time will you come back from work?

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to decrease; to descend
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: House prices have come down recently.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to arise or occur; to approach
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Something urgent came up at work.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to depend on someone or something
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: You can count on me to help you.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to reduce the amount of something
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: The doctor advised him to cut down on sugar.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to disconnect; to remove by cutting
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: The phone line was cut off during the storm.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to handle or manage a situation
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: How do you deal with stress at work?

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to wear formal or special clothes
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: We need to dress up for the wedding.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to visit briefly without arrangement
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Feel free to drop by anytime.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to deliver someone or something to a place
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Can you drop me off at the train station?

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to finally be in a particular situation
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: We ended up staying home instead of going out.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to break into pieces; to fail completely
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: The old book fell apart when I touched it.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to understand or solve something
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: I can't figure out how to use this new software.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to complete a form; to substitute for someone
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Please fill in this application form.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to discover information
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: I need to find out what time the store closes.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to have a good relationship with someone
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Sarah and her roommate get along very well.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to escape; to go on vacation
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: The thief managed to get away.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to manage or survive with difficulty
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: We can get by on one income for now.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to recover from an illness or disappointment
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: It took him months to get over the breakup.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to rise from bed; to stand up
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: I get up at 7 AM every weekday.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to donate; to reveal a secret
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: She gave away all her old clothes.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to surrender or yield
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: After hours of arguing, he finally gave in.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to stop trying or quit
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Don't give up on your dreams so easily.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to proceed; to give permission
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Go ahead and start the meeting without me.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to review or examine carefully
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Let's go over the report one more time.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to mature; to become an adult
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: I grew up in a small town in Ohio.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to submit something
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Students must hand in their essays by Friday.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to spend time relaxing with friends
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Let's hang out at the park this afternoon.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to assist someone
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Can you help out with the dishes?

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to wait; to grip something tightly
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Hold on a moment, I'll be right back.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to delay; to rob at gunpoint
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Traffic is holding up our journey.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to participate in an activity
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Everyone joined in the singing.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to continue doing something
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Keep on practicing and you'll improve.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to maintain the same pace or level
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: It's hard to keep up with all the changes.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to make unconscious; to eliminate from competition
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: The boxer was knocked out in the third round.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to dismiss employees; to stop bothering someone
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: The company had to lay off 50 workers.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to omit or exclude something
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: You left out an important detail.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to disappoint someone
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: I don't want to let my team down.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to access a computer system
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Please log in with your username and password.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to take care of someone or something
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: She looks after her elderly grandmother.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to anticipate something with pleasure
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: I'm looking forward to the weekend.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to be careful; to watch for something
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Look out for pickpockets in crowded areas.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to search for information; to improve
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Look up the word in the dictionary.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to see or understand with difficulty; to kiss passionately
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: I can't make out what this handwriting says.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to invent a story; to reconcile after an argument
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: They made up after their silly fight.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to confuse one thing with another
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: I always mix up their names.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to continue to the next thing; to get over something
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: After the divorce, she decided to move on.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to start a business; to become more communicative
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: She finally opened up about her feelings.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to go past something
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: I pass by the library on my way to work.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to faint; to distribute
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: He passed out from the heat.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to lift something; to collect someone or something
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: I'll pick you up at 7 PM for dinner.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to indicate or draw attention to something
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: She pointed out the error in my calculation.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to stop a vehicle at the side of the road
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: The police officer asked me to pull over.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to place something on a surface; to criticize
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Put down that heavy box and rest.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to postpone or delay something
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: We had to put off the meeting until next week.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to wear clothing; to pretend
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Put on your coat before going outside.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to accommodate someone; to tolerate
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Can you put me up for the night?

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to meet someone unexpectedly
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: I ran into my old teacher at the grocery store.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to have no more of something left
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: We've run out of milk.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to return something to where it came from
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: I had to send back the defective product.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to establish or arrange something
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: They set up a new business in downtown.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to become calm; to start living a stable life
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: After years of traveling, he decided to settle down.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to appear or arrive
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: He didn't show up for the meeting.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to close permanently; to stop operating
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: The factory shut down due to financial problems.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to reduce speed or pace
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: You're driving too fast, please slow down.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to talk more loudly; to express an opinion
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Please speak up, I can't hear you.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to rise to one's feet; to fail to meet someone
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Please stand up when the judge enters.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to return something; to withdraw a statement
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: I take back what I said about your cooking.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to look after someone or something
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Can you take care of my plants while I'm away?

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to remove clothing; to leave suddenly; (of planes) to leave the ground
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: The plane will take off in ten minutes.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to consider something carefully
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Let me think over your proposal.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to discard something; to waste an opportunity
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Don't throw away those old magazines yet.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to put on clothing to see if it fits
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: I need to try on these shoes before buying them.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to refuse or reject; to reduce volume
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: She turned down the job offer.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to stop a machine or device
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Don't forget to turn off the computer.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to start a machine or device
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Please turn on the lights.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to arrive; to increase volume
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: She turned up unexpectedly at the party.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to consume completely
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: We used up all our savings on the vacation.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to stop sleeping; to become alert
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: I wake up at 6 AM every morning.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to heat something; to prepare for exercise
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Let's warm up before we start jogging.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to be careful or alert
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Watch out for that hole in the road.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to exercise; to solve a problem
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: I work out at the gym three times a week.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to record something in writing
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Write down your phone number for me.

phrasal_verbs.meaning: to close with a zipper
phrasal_verbs.usage_example: Zip up your jacket, it's cold outside.
